channel.title: Science
channel.description:
I recently had a Science test, a question has been bothering me.
"What substance does magnesium + hydrochloric acid make?"
My formula was: [code]hydrochloric acid + magnesium -> hydrogen + magnesium chloride[/code] hydrochloric acid + magnesium being the products if anyone doesn't understand hydrogen + magnesium chloride being the reactants. To make sure it contained hydrogen I concluded a 'pop' test, it worked. Now the substance people tell me it makes is hydrogen, however my answer was magnesium chloride. Am I right or am I wrong? Can someone please explain.

item.title: Science

item.description:
@USMC wrote:

hydrochloric acid + magnesium -> hydrogen + magnesium chloride

Hydrogen AND Mg chloride.
